snippet: Weeks after Hurricane Sandy, some residents of the Lower Manhattan are bound to leases and required to pay their rent even though their apartments are currently uninhabitable.
abstract: Residents of Lower Manhattan are finding restoration of services erratic following Hurricane Sandy, with some areas appearing as if storm never happened, and others still without heat or power; relationships between residential building management companies and tenants have frayed; some managers are giving out rent credits for each day residents cannot use their apartments, or letting tenants break leases and move out.
lead_paragraph: Weeks after Hurricane Sandy, some residents of the Lower Manhattan are bound to leases and required to pay their rent even though their apartments are currently uninhabitable.

headline.seo: Patchy Recovery Persists in Lower Manhattan, With No Timeline to Re-enter Houses
headline.main: Lower Manhattan’s Recovery Is Patchy, With People Still Barred From Their Homes
headline.print_headline: Lower Manhattan’s Recovery Is Patchy, With People Still Barred From Their Homes
